Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋「切磋琢磨」
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋「質実剛健」
Entry.EnglishText: Armor Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカ・装備品屋
Entry.EnglishText: Petnadjanka - Weapon Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『商品の陳列棚』 「コチラ見本用、 商品はカウンターにて」 と書かれている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- A Display Case of Products - "Samples are for display only. See counter if you wish to make a purchase." ...is written on the display case.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『お客様にお願い』 見本品での試し斬り、試し叩きなどお断り。 同行為をされた方は商品を相当額で お買い上げいただきます。 店主
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- A Request to All Customers - Please refrain from testing out the display products. Those who do so will be required to purchase the product at full price. -Storekeeper

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『宣伝用の看板』 ★満月の日はサービスデー！ 全品三割引きの超特価！ 武器屋「切磋琢磨」
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Signboard - ★Full Moon Sale! 30% off for all items! Here only at Discipline!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマは本当に 仕事をよくさぼりやがるな。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma really like slacking off, don't they?

Entry.JapaneseText: ここはオニの<Tytree>の口から うちのガジュマにびしっと 言ってやってくれないか？
Entry.EnglishText: How about you talk some proper sense into the one working here, <Tytree>?

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんだよ、 この地鳴りは…… せ、世界の終わりか……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-What the--!? Th-The ground is shaking... Is the world ending!?

Entry.JapaneseText: 攻撃は最大の防御なり！ 武器をそろえないでどうする！
Entry.EnglishText: Offense is the best defense! Where would we be without weapons?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 武器を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Weapons Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 気が向いたら、 また来いよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Feel free to come again when you change your mind.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋には負けないぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not going to let the weapons shop beat me!

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の中に誰もいないって？ まさか俺っちだけ仲間外れ……？
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? There's no one else in town? Does that mean that I'm the only one left....?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……じゃないか。 防具屋のヤツもいる事だし、 まあ、いいか……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Oh, I guess not. The guy at the weapons shop is still here. Whatever...

Entry.JapaneseText: まさか、俺っちのとこで 買った剣で<Tytree>を 殺したり……？
Entry.EnglishText: You're not planning on killing <Tytree> with the swords I sell, are you...?

Entry.JapaneseText: そ、それだけは やめてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: N-Now, no need to go that far...

Entry.JapaneseText: よかった、<Tytree>…… なんか騒ぎに巻き込まれてるとは 聞いてたけど、無事で何よりだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, thank god... I heard something happened to you, but it looks like you're unharmed.

Entry.JapaneseText: で、セレーナが 大変だって聞いたけど…… どうしたんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: But I heard that Selena is in danger... What happened?

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらが<Tytree>を 助けたんだって？
Entry.EnglishText: Were you the ones who saved <Tytree>?

Entry.JapaneseText: 同じ街の仲間を救ってくれた お礼はしたいが、ウチの商品を やるわけにはいかねえな。
Entry.EnglishText: I want to thank you for saving him, but I can't really part with my products.

Entry.JapaneseText: ま、気持ちだけ受け取ってくれ。 どうだい、この笑顔？
Entry.EnglishText: Well, you can have my feelings of gratitude. I hope my smile will suffice?

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナが戻ってきたって みんな喜んでるそうだな。
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that everyone is happy now that Selena's back.

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナって、 どこかに行ってたのか？
Entry.EnglishText: Did she go somewhere or something?

Entry.JapaneseText: 商売が忙しいもんで、 最近、世情にうとくてな。
Entry.EnglishText: Sorry, I've been so caught up with work that I'm a bit out of the loop.

Entry.JapaneseText: おお、<Tytree>の友達だな。 ま、安くはできんが、 見てってくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh you're <Tytree>'s pals, right? Well, I can't give you a discount, but feel free to browse.

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋の奴、 何怒ってんだろうな？ なんか俺悪い事したか？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what the guy at the armor shop's pissed about? Did I do something wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>、 聞いてみてくんないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, <Tytree>, can I talk to you for a sec?

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の防具屋の野郎の 俺を見る目つきが なんかむかつくんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: So that guy at the armor shop, the one over there? Well, the way he looks at me kind of pisses me off.

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、どうしたって いうんだろうな？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what his problem is.

Entry.JapaneseText: なあ、近頃、 ガジュマたちの様子が おかしいと思わないか？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, don't you think the Gajuma have been acting a little strange lately?

Entry.JapaneseText: この街はみんな 仲良くやってたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone in this town used to get along.

Entry.JapaneseText: 後からやって来た ガジュマが悪いんだな、きっと。
Entry.EnglishText: But ever since those Gajuma showed up... They've got to be the ones behind this.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、街の中に ガジュマが増えたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There's been more Gajuma around Petnadjanka lately.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんでもよその街を追い出されたんだと。そのせいか、俺たちヒューマを見る目が コワイんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently they were kicked out of other towns. I guess that's why they watch us with a scary gaze.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺たちが悪い事をしたわけじゃ ないのにな……
Entry.EnglishText: But it's not like any of us have done anything wrong...

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にガジュマめ、 むかつくぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: Gajuma really piss me off.

Entry.JapaneseText: このあいだなんか、隣の防具屋の野郎、 俺をこの店から追い出そうとしやがって……
Entry.EnglishText: You know the guy in the armor shop over there? He's trying to get me to leave the store...

Entry.JapaneseText: こっちはこの場所で 先祖代々やってきたってんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: ...But my family has been working this store for generations!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマ……あんたみたいな よそ者のガジュマが、 この街をおかしくしたんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma... Outsiders like you are ruining this city!

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたガジュマと 一緒にいるのはやめた方がいいぜ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'd advise you to stop travelling with that Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 連中、ひがみっぽいし、 なんにでもケチをつけやがる
Entry.EnglishText: They've got a serious victim complex and are always complaining about something.

Entry.JapaneseText: 本当にどうしようもない 連中だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: They're totally hopeless!

Entry.JapaneseText: どこかの田舎娘が 工場でのもめ事を解決してから、 工場も落ち着いたみたいだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently a girl from the countryside helped settle the disputes over at the factory, and things have calmed down.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも防具屋の野郎は 相変わらずなんだよな。
Entry.EnglishText: The guy over there hasn't changed a bit, though.

Entry.JapaneseText: よほど、俺に 不満とかあったのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: I guess he must be really unhappy with me?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとおしゃべりなんぞ したくないね。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no desire to talk to Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんか最近、俺おかしいよな。 ガジュマの事、急に嫌いに なったりして。
Entry.EnglishText: Something must have gotten into me recently... It seems that I've adopted a sudden disdain towards Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……そもそも ガジュマが悪いんだよな……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Nah, never mind. It's their fault I feel this way, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: 俺を追い出そうと するから……なぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: Because they're trying to kick me out of here... Yeah...

Entry.JapaneseText: 防具屋の奴がここんとこ 妙に静かなのが気になるな。
Entry.EnglishText: That guy at the armor shop's been quiet lately. It's starting to bother me...

Entry.JapaneseText: 生きてるんだろうな？ <Tytree>、確かめてくれよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You still alive, <Tytree>? Lemme make sure...

Entry.JapaneseText: 旅の人にはわからないだろうけど 街が以前に比べると静かな気がするんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: You travellers probably wouldn't be able to tell, but things have been abnormally quiet around here compared to before.

Entry.JapaneseText: あのもめ事以来かな。 人と人の関係が少しだけ 変わった気がするよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess ever since that dispute, interpersonal relationships have been changing little by little.

Entry.JapaneseText: 特にガジュマと ヒューマの関係がね。
Entry.EnglishText: Especially the ones between Gajuma and Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の防具屋とは 創業時期が一緒でね。
Entry.EnglishText: This store and the armor shop next door were founded at the same time.

Entry.JapaneseText: 七代前のご先祖様からの よきライバルなのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: We've been good rivals for around seven generations.

Entry.JapaneseText: ちゃ、ちゃんと 働いてますよ……!!
Entry.EnglishText: I-I'm doing a good job, sir...!

Entry.JapaneseText: あーあ、まったく やってらんねえな……
Entry.EnglishText: Ohhh... man, do I not want to work...

Entry.JapaneseText: あ……<Tytree>さん……!! な、なんでもありません……!!
Entry.EnglishText: Oh... Hello there sir! N-No problems here!

Entry.JapaneseText: な、なんで こんなに地鳴りが……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-Why's the ground shaking...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 攻撃の前に、まずは 自分の身を守れないと。
Entry.EnglishText: Take care of your defenses before going on the offensive.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 防具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Armor Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: また来てくださいね。
Entry.EnglishText: Come back again!

Entry.JapaneseText: 武器屋には負けないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not going to let the weapons shop beat me!

Entry.JapaneseText: え？ 街の中に誰もいない？ さあ、どうしたんだろう……
Entry.EnglishText: Huh? There's no one in town? I wonder what's going on...

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラだけ仲間外れ……？
Entry.EnglishText: I'm I the only one still left...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……なんか…… 気になってきたな……
Entry.EnglishText: Now I'm worried...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>が工場の中で 大変な事になってるって？
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>'s in danger over at the factory?

Entry.JapaneseText: えっと……こんな時、オイラは…… ……どうすればいいんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: Uh... So... What am I supposed to do about that?

Entry.JapaneseText: がんばれよ、<Tytree>。 落ち込みそうだったら、 オイラの顔を思い出してくれよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Good luck out there, <Tytree>. Whenever you feel down, just remember my face!

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだよ、なんだよ、 そのイヤそうな顔は……？
Entry.EnglishText: Wh-Why are you looking at me like that...?

Entry.JapaneseText: 君たちなら、きっとセレーナさんを 取り戻してくれる。 なんでか、そんな気がするな。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm sure you guys will be able to save Selena. I've just got a feeling you can do it.

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、旅には防具は欠かせないよ。 どんな強い人でもね。
Entry.EnglishText: But even if you're strong, you can't neglect buying armor for your journey.

Entry.JapaneseText: そう、人には必ず愛が必要なように、 旅人にはまた防具が必要なのさ！
Entry.EnglishText: Just like how everyone of us needs love, everyone who travels needs armor.

Entry.JapaneseText: セレーナさんが助かったみたいだけど、 <Tytree>は、 まだ旅を続けるのかい？
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that you've managed to save Selena, but I take it your journey still isn't over?

Entry.JapaneseText: だったらうちで防具を そろえていってくれよな。
Entry.EnglishText: Well then, you need to buy yourself some armor!

Entry.JapaneseText: さすが、キミたちなら 必ずセレーナさんを 助けてくれるって思ってた。
Entry.EnglishText: I always knew you guys would be able to save Selena.

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラの勘は、隣の武器屋で 売ってる剣の刃よりも 鋭いからね。
Entry.EnglishText: My intuition is sharper than the blades they sell next door, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、妙にヒューマに 腹が立つ事はないかい？
Entry.EnglishText: Have you been feeling stranglely agitated around Huma recently?

Entry.JapaneseText: オイラは毎日さ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been having that feeling every day.

Entry.JapaneseText: 隣の武器屋の顔を見るたびに ムカムカしてさ。
Entry.EnglishText: Whenever I see the guy next door, I get pissed off.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>……か…… 悪いけど……買い物したら、 帰ってくれないか……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh... hi, <Tytree>... Sorry, but... after you're done shopping, can you leave right away...?

Entry.JapaneseText: いや……すまない……
Entry.EnglishText: Ah— No... Sorry...

Entry.JapaneseText: 無駄話するなら、帰んなよ。 ここは防具屋だ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you're here to waste my time with idle talk, then just go home. This is an armor <Italic>shop</Italic>, after all.

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてヒューマなんて いるのかね……
Entry.EnglishText: Why do Huma even exist...?

Entry.JapaneseText: もういい加減、 ヒューマの隣で店やってるなんて 耐えられなくなってきたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've had enough! I can't stand having to run a shop next to that damn Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマには荷物まとめて、 さっさと出ていってほしい くらいだね。
Entry.EnglishText: Honestly, I wish that guy would just pack his bags and leave.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>だっておんなじさ！
Entry.EnglishText: That goes for you too, <Tytree>!

Entry.JapaneseText: 品物を買わないんなら、 さっさと帰れ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you're not going to buy anything, then leave!

Entry.JapaneseText: 工場の連中、ヒューマの娘に そそのかされてさ。
Entry.EnglishText: That Huma girl has led everyone at the factory astray!

Entry.JapaneseText: みんな、ヒューマの娘に そそのかされてるんじゃ ないのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: I bet she's done the same to everyone else here in town, too!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはとりあえず、 この街から出ていけ！
Entry.EnglishText: Huma need to leave this town!

Entry.JapaneseText: よくよく考えてみたら、 何もひとつの建物をふたつの店で 使う事ないよね。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking that this building is a bit too small for two stores.

Entry.JapaneseText: よし……ヒューマの武器屋なんて 追い出してやるぞ……！
Entry.EnglishText: Well then... Guess I'll have to get rid of that armor shop run by that Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマはとりあえず、 この街から出ていけ！
Entry.EnglishText: Huma need to leave this town!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマとヒューマが いがみ合いすぎて、ラジルダは 水の中に沈んだって聞いたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that the fighting between Huma and Gajuma in Razilda was so intense that the town sank into the water.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは気にくわないけど…… ちょっとおとなしくしとこう……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't like Huma, but... I think I'll keep my head down for now...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマは……！ いや……なんでもない……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are...! Actually, never mind...

Entry.JapaneseText: ペトナジャンカで 防具屋といえば、うちだけ！
Entry.EnglishText: If you need armor here in Petnadjanka, then I'm your guy!

Entry.JapaneseText: ここで買わずして、 どこで買う？
Entry.EnglishText: Because if you can't buy it here, then where else can you?
